dt: {bc}to read or mark so as to show metrical structure
{bc}to examine by point-by-point observation or checking:
{bc}to investigate thoroughly by checking point by point and often repeatedly

dt.t: a fire lookout {it}scanning{/it} the hills with binoculars

dt: {bc}to glance from point to point of often hastily, casually, or in search of a particular item

dt.t: {wi}scan{/wi} the want ads looking for a job

dt: {bc}to examine systematically (as by passing a beam of radiation over or through) in order to obtain data especially for display or storage
{bc}to pass over in the formation of an image

dt.t: the electron beam {wi}scans{/wi} the picture tube

pt: {sc}scrutinize{/sc} {sc}scan{/sc} {sc}inspect{/sc} {sc}examine{/sc} mean to look at or over. {sc}scrutinize{/sc} stresses close attention to minute detail.
{sc}scan{/sc} implies a surveying from point to point often suggesting a cursory overall observation.
{sc}inspect{/sc} implies scrutinizing for errors or defects.
{sc}examine{/sc} suggests a scrutiny in order to determine the nature, condition, or quality of a thing.

et: Middle English {it}scannen{/it}, from Late Latin {it}scandere{/it}, from Latin, to climb; akin to Middle Irish {it}sceinnid{/it} he springs, Sanskrit {it}skandati{/it} he leaps
shortdef: to read or mark so as to show metrical structure
to examine by point-by-point observation or checking:
to investigate thoroughly by checking point by point and often repeatedly
